overview:
## Overview

Siri creates an [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INDeleteTasksIntent] object when the user marks one or more tasks for deletion. The intent object can contain the task information.

To handle this intent, the handler object in your Intents extension must adopt the [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INDeleteTasksIntentHandling] protocol. Your handler should confirm the request and create an [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INDeleteTasksIntentResponse] object with the updated task information.

### Additional Intent Attributes

The following table lists additional attributes of this intent object:

### Example Phrases

Users can ask Siri to delete tasks in a variety of ways. The table below provides a few sample phrases in different languages. You can use these phrases during testing to trigger your intents. This list isn’t exhaustive and Siri may recognize many other phrases.

In the preceding examples, `<appName>` represents the name of the app whose Intents extension handles the request.

# INDeleteTasksIntent

**Class**

A request to delete one or more tasks.

## Declaration

```swift
class INDeleteTasksIntent
```

## Overview

Siri creates an [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INDeleteTasksIntent] object when the user marks one or more tasks for deletion. The intent object can contain the task information.

To handle this intent, the handler object in your Intents extension must adopt the [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INDeleteTasksIntentHandling] protocol. Your handler should confirm the request and create an [doc://com.apple.sirikit/documentation/Intents/INDeleteTasksIntentResponse] object with the updated task information.

### Additional Intent Attributes

The following table lists additional attributes of this intent object:



### Example Phrases

Users can ask Siri to delete tasks in a variety of ways. The table below provides a few sample phrases in different languages. You can use these phrases during testing to trigger your intents. This list isn’t exhaustive and Siri may recognize many other phrases.



In the preceding examples, `<appName>` represents the name of the app whose Intents extension handles the request.

## Initializing the Intent Object

- **init(taskList:tasks:all:)**: Creates the intent object with information about the task list and the tasks to delete from it.

## Getting the Task Information

- **taskList**: The task list from which to delete tasks.
- **tasks**: The tasks to delete from a task list.
- **all**: A Boolean value that indicates whether to delete all the tasks from a task list.

## Task Deletion

- **INDeleteTasksIntentHandling**: An interface that handles requests to delete tasks from a task list.
- **INDeleteTasksIntentResponse**: Your response to a request to delete tasks.
- **INDeleteTasksTaskListResolutionResult**: A resolution result for deleting task lists.
- **INDeleteTasksTaskResolutionResult**: A resolution result for deleting tasks.

## Inherits From

- INIntent

## Conforms To

- CVarArg
- CustomDebugStringConvertible
- CustomStringConvertible
- Equatable
- Hashable
- INIntentSetImageKeyPath
- NSCoding
- NSCopying
- NSObjectProtocol
- NSSecureCoding
